summary: This is an internal email chain from October 2019 within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, forwarding a request for data on human trafficking victim interviews. The request is sent by an Assistant U.S. Attorney who is a Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator, seeking information from various units to gauge the volume of cases.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator, Money Laundering & Transnational Criminal Enterprise Unit
persons.context: The sender of the initial request email, asking units to report on the number of human trafficking victims interviewed in the past year.

events.title: Data Request on Human Trafficking Victims
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends an email request to unit chiefs asking for data on the number of unique human trafficking victims interviewed in the past year, with a deadline of the close of business that day.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from October 4, 2019, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

The subject line 'FW: Request' and the text 'Other than Epstein, we would have' suggests this communication is part of a broader context, possibly related to the Epstein investigation, though the main request is about general human trafficking victim data.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney, serving as a Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator, is soliciting information from various units to understand the volume of human trafficking victim interviews conducted.
The request emphasizes that the data should include all victims, regardless of whether the case was charged, and acknowledges that some units may have zero cases.

The document's file number (EFTA00013175) and its inclusion in the Epstein case data set indicate it is part of the released materials related to the investigation, though its direct connection to Epstein is not detailed in the provided text.
